posts.post_content:
I've never been more scared than when I saw this on a [Prototype Portal](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Prototype Portal), and then the Galvanic-Palladium combo come out.  
The moral of this story is to pack artifact destruction wherever you go, for the love of all that is good

posts.post_content:
Fits the burn deck niche quite nicely. AS mentioned, [Shrapnel blast](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Shrapnel blast) for 7 to the face or divided depending on the situation (i.e. 2 and 5 to separate targets). Works as fodder for [Trash for Treasure](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Trash for Treasure), though keep in mind I would NOT recommend returning one of these guys with that card. I got a very nasty look when I used [Brute force](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Brute force) and gave it +3/+3 making it a 4/4. My opponent didn't realize the 2 damage trigger and went red in the face. Not sure but [Furnace of rath](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Furnace of rath) for mid game control?  
  
Here's how I would go infinite (fewer colours the better methinks)  
  
T1: [Cloudpost](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cloudpost)  
T2: [Glimmerpost](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Glimmerpost), Gain 2 life, make 3 mana, play incubator choosing Myr, Drop this guy (or your entire hand if the draw is right)  
T3: [Blasting station](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Blasting station), [Altar of dementia](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Altar of dementia) or some sac outlet.  
T4: [Enduring renewal](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Enduring renewal), go infinite, and it doe... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
